$schema: Titan composition patterns — real UI recipes extracted from Audiense/Demand/Insights/TweetBinder products for MCP code generation
notes: Each pattern includes: description, Titan components used, JSX template, layout guidance, and gaps (components that need React Aria + tokens fallback).
Charts are intentional slots — the MCP should leave a placeholder where a chart library renders.
All spacing uses Titan CSS custom properties (--spacing-*).
All patterns assume titan.css + theme CSS + titan-compositions/styles are loaded.

layoutPatterns._selectionRule: If the user mentions 'sidebar', 'side navigation', 'lateral menu', or the screen has a visible sidebar: use appLayoutWithSidebar. Otherwise, use appLayoutNoSidebar. NEVER nest one layout inside another.

appLayoutWithSidebar.name: App Layout with Sidebar
appLayoutWithSidebar.description: Full-viewport layout: sidebar on the far left (full height), navbar + content stacked on the right. The sidebar is always flush-left and stretches from top to bottom of the viewport. The content area scrolls independently.
appLayoutWithSidebar.jsx:
setCollapsed(!collapsed)} activeId={activeId} onActiveChange={setActiveId}> Home Reports All reports Workflows Audience overlap Creator discovery More apps
{/* Page content here */}
appLayoutWithSidebar.layout: Root is flex row, height 100vh. Sidebar is flex-shrink:0, full height. Right column is flex:1 with navbar on top and scrollable content below. minWidth:0 on right column prevents overflow.

appLayoutNoSidebar.name: App Layout without Sidebar
appLayoutNoSidebar.description: Standard layout: navbar on top, content below. No sidebar. Used when the user does NOT mention sidebar or side navigation.
appLayoutNoSidebar.jsx:
<>
  <TitanNavbar theme="demand" userInitial="A" />
  <main className="page">
    {/* Page content here */}
  </main>
</>
appLayoutNoSidebar.layout: Navbar at top, content below in .page container. No flex wrapper needed.

reportListPage.name: Report List Page
reportListPage.description: Navbar + page title + subtitle counter + primary CTA top-right + borderless table with typed columns (name with icon, type as pill/tag, date, status dot, avatar, access icon, 3-dot action menu with cascading submenu) + footer row count.
reportListPage.jsx:
<>

My reports

37 entities available

}>New report
}, { key: 'created', header: 'Created' }, { key: 'status', header: 'Status', render: (row) => {row.status} }, { key: 'owner', header: 'Owner', render: (row) => {row.ownerInitial} }, { key: 'actions', header: 'Actions', render: (row) => ( } triggerLabel="Row actions" placement="bottom end" items={row.actionItems} /> )} ]} rows={rows} />

4 reports created
reportListPage.layout: Single full-width card inside .page container. Table takes full width of card.
gaps: StatusDot (colored dot + label) — use inline span with background-color from Titan color tokens

wizardStepLayout.name: Wizard Step Layout
wizardStepLayout.description: Back button (left) + centered title + Next/Launch CTA (right). Main content card below. Optional tabs for mode switching. Optional alternative path footer.
wizardStepLayout.jsx:
<>
}>Back

Define your audience

}>Next
{/* Main step content */}
OR
wizardStepLayout.layout: Sticky header row with 3-column flex (back | title | next). Content below in .page. Optional footer row.

formSidebarStatusPage.name: Form + Sidebar Status Page
formSidebarStatusPage.description: Back + title + CTA header. 2-column layout (~10/16 main form + ~6/16 sidebar). Main: input with counter, textarea, grouped cards. Sidebar: progress status card + summary card.
formSidebarStatusPage.jsx:
<>
}>Back

Define report

}>Launch report

Add your entities (max: 37)

Description text...

Clear all Review Entities Information

Entities Status

{/* ProgressSummary: progress bar + status counts */}

Report Summary

Entities in your report: 0
formSidebarStatusPage.layout: CardGrid 12+4 split. Left card holds stacked form sections. Right card holds status + summary.
gaps: ProgressBar with status counters — use React Aria ProgressBar + Titan tokens

dashboardInsightsPage.name: Dashboard Insights Page
dashboardInsightsPage.description: Analytics page with multiple cards in grid. Typically: row of 4 KPI cards (span 4 each), then wider data cards (span 8 or 16) with tables, bars, entity lists, charts.
dashboardInsightsPage.jsx:
<>
  <TitanNavbar theme="insights" userInitial="A" />
  <main className="page">
    <TitanBreadcrumb items={[{ id: 'home', label: 'Home' }, { id: 'reports', label: 'Reports' }]} currentLabel="Star Wars" />
    <TitanCardGrid>
      <TitanCard span={4}>{/* KPI Summary Card */}</TitanCard>
      <TitanCard span={4}>{/* KPI Summary Card */}</TitanCard>
      <TitanCard span={4}>{/* KPI Summary Card */}</TitanCard>
      <TitanCard span={4}>{/* KPI Summary Card */}</TitanCard>
    </TitanCardGrid>
    <TitanCardGrid>
      <TitanCard span={8}>{/* Metric list or chart */}</TitanCard>
      <TitanCard span={8}>{/* Ranking or chart */}</TitanCard>
    </TitanCardGrid>
    <TitanCardGrid>
      <TitanCard span={16}>{/* Full-width table or chart */}</TitanCard>
    </TitanCardGrid>
  </main>
</>
dashboardInsightsPage.layout: Multiple CardGrid rows. First row: 4x span-4. Subsequent rows: 2x span-8 or 1x span-16. Cards fill with data components or chart placeholders.

kpiSummaryCard.name: KPI Summary Card
kpiSummaryCard.description: Small card (span 4) with: title + info tooltip, subtitle, hero metric (big number + percentage), supporting detail rows. Variants: ranked list with score badges, icon + value, flag + country.
kpiSummaryCard.jsx:
Top Entities

Based on the cross-channel performance

Star Wars Episode III

Star Wars: Phantom Menace 75
kpiSummaryCard.layout: Always used inside TitanCardGrid as span={4}. Internal layout is vertical stack with flexbox rows for detail lines.

entityListCard.name: Entity List Card
entityListCard.description: Card with title + tooltip, subtitle, list of rows: [icon/flag] + [label] + chevron > + [bold detail text, truncated]. Optional horizontal divider separating subsections within the same card.
entityListCard.jsx:
Relevance per Country

Most relevant entities per country

{items.map(item => (
{item.flag} {item.code} {item.entities}
))}
{/* Optional divider between sections */}
{/* Second subsection with same row pattern */}
entityListCard.layout: Full-width card (span 16) or half (span 8). Rows are flex with truncation on trailing text.

metricListCardWithBars.name: Metric List Card with Bars
metricListCardWithBars.description: Card with title + tooltip. Each row: icon + category name, horizontal bar (colored segment + gray track) + percentage, secondary value (multiplier like 1.93x). Optional tinted header.
metricListCardWithBars.jsx:
Top Interests

{items.map(item => (
{item.name}
Penetration {/* ComparisonBar placeholder */}
{item.penetration}%
Followers

↑ {item.multiplier}x

))}
metricListCardWithBars.layout: span 8 card. Internal list with separator borders. Each row is a 2-level stack: name row + metrics row.
gaps: ComparisonBar — inline div with background track + colored fill using Titan color tokens

searchableDataCard.name: Searchable Data Card with Table
searchableDataCard.description: Card with title + tooltip, search input with leading icon, sortable table below with comparison bars and badge values.
searchableDataCard.jsx:
Schools

} style={{ maxWidth: 360, marginBottom: 'var(--spacing-m)' }} /> /* DualComparisonBar */ null }, { key: 'affinity', header: 'Affinity', render: (row) => {row.affinity} } ]} rows={filteredRows} />
searchableDataCard.layout: Full-width card. Search input at top with max-width. Table takes remaining space.
gaps: DualComparisonBar (two stacked bars for audience vs baseline) — inline divs with Titan color tokens

comparisonTableCard.name: Comparison Table Card
comparisonTableCard.description: Card with title + tooltip. Sortable table with: label column, dual comparison bars (audience vs baseline) + percentages, value badge column.
comparisonTableCard.jsx:
Seniority

(
{row.audiencePct}%
{row.baselinePct}%
)}, { key: 'affinity', header: 'Affinity', render: (row) => {row.affinity} } ]} rows={rows} />
comparisonTableCard.layout: Full-width or span-16 card. Table with custom render columns for bars.

distributionComparisonCard.name: Distribution Comparison Card (x3 row)
distributionComparisonCard.description: 3 cards in a row (~5/16 each). Each: tinted title, description + 'Read more' link, sorted distribution table with dual comparison bars, legend with colored dots, 'Show full table' or 'Download' link at bottom.
distributionComparisonCard.jsx:

{dist.title}

{dist.description} Read more

{row.label} {/* DualComparisonBar for each audience */}
))}

Show full table → ))}
distributionComparisonCard.layout: CardGrid with 3x span-5 cards (or approximate). Note: 5+5+5=15 leaves 1 col gap, adjust with custom CSS or use 16-col fractions.

centeredInsightCard.name: Centered Insight Card
centeredInsightCard.description: Card with centered layout: large icon top, title, centered description, horizontal divider, chart/visual placeholder below, legend.
centeredInsightCard.jsx:
Credit cards

Members of the audience that are likely to prefer using credit cards for shopping

{/* Chart placeholder (donut charts) */}
{/* Chart slots */}
centeredInsightCard.layout: span 8 card. All content centered with grid justifyItems center.

categoryComparisonCard.name: Category Comparison Card
categoryComparisonCard.description: Card with title, description + 'Read more' link, N categories laid out horizontally (2 or 3). Each category: icon + large label, comparison bars below. Shared legend at bottom.
categoryComparisonCard.jsx:
Device

This graph shows the devices used by the audience. Read more

{categories.map(cat => (
{cat.icon} {cat.label}
{/* DualComparisonBar for each audience */}
))}
{/* Shared legend */}
{audiences.map(a => ( {a.name} ))}
categoryComparisonCard.layout: Full-width card. Internal grid columns (repeat 2 or 3). Legend row at bottom.

includeExcludeFilterDialog.name: Include/Exclude Filter Dialog
includeExcludeFilterDialog.description: Dialog/panel with title + subtitle + close X. 2-column layout: 'Include any' (focused/highlighted border) and 'Exclude all'. Each column has a textarea. Footer with helper text + Cancel + Apply.
includeExcludeFilterDialog.jsx:
Words that audience members use to describe themselves in their social media profiles

Include any

Exclude all

Use commas or hit enter to separate them

} leftAction={Cancel} rightAction={Apply} />
includeExcludeFilterDialog.layout: Dialog body has 2-column grid. Each column contains a section header + textarea.

confirmDeleteDialog.name: Confirm/Delete Dialog
confirmDeleteDialog.description: Simple confirmation dialog: centered title, body text, Cancel + Delete/Confirm action buttons.
confirmDeleteDialog.jsx:
<TitanDialog
  triggerLabel="Delete report"
  title="Delete report?"
  body="This action cannot be undone. The report will be permanently removed."
  leftAction={<TitanButton variant="secondary">Cancel</TitanButton>}
  rightAction={<TitanButton variant="delete">Delete</TitanButton>}
/>

formInDialog.name: Form in Dialog
formInDialog.description: Dialog with form fields in the body: input fields, textareas, selects, checkboxes. Cancel + Save/Submit actions.
formInDialog.jsx:
<TitanDialog
  triggerLabel="Create report"
  title="New report"
  body={
    <form style={{ display: 'grid', gap: 'var(--spacing-m)', textAlign: 'left' }}>
      <TitanInputField label="Report name" placeholder="Enter report name" isRequired />
      <TitanSelect label="Report type" options={[
        { id: 'influencer', label: 'Influencer' },
        { id: 'demand', label: 'Demand' }
      ]} />
      <TitanTextareaField label="Description" placeholder="Add a description..." />
      <TitanCheckboxField label="Include all post types" />
    </form>
  }
  leftAction={<TitanButton variant="secondary">Cancel</TitanButton>}
  rightAction={<TitanButton variant="primary">Create</TitanButton>}
/>
formInDialog.layout: Dialog body contains a form with vertical grid gap. Text-align left overrides dialog's centered default.

multiColumnTermBuilder.name: Multi-Column Term Builder
multiColumnTermBuilder.description: Tabs at top (Basic Query / Boolean Query). 3 column cards: 'Include ANY', 'Include ALL', 'Exclude ALL'. Each column has title + subtitle + pill input area with dismissable colored pills. Footer: helper text + 'Clear all' link.
multiColumnTermBuilder.jsx:
<>

Include ANY of these Terms

Posts should contain ANY of the terms entered below:

{includeAnyTerms.map(t => )}

Include ALL of these Terms

Posts should contain ALL of the terms:

{includeAllTerms.map(t => )}

Exclude ALL of these Terms

Posts shouldn't contain ANY of the terms:

{excludeTerms.map(t => )}

Separate terms with commas or press Enter.

Clear all )}, { id: 'boolean', label: 'Boolean Query', content: } ]} />
multiColumnTermBuilder.layout: Tabs with content. Basic tab: 3-column CardGrid (span 5 each). Each card contains a pill input area styled as a bordered box.
gaps: PillInputArea (textarea-like area that converts typed text into dismissable pills) — compose with TitanPill + input handling

reportConfigurationForm.name: Report Configuration Form
reportConfigurationForm.description: Multi-column layout. Left: selectable cards stacked vertically (acts as visual radio). Center: radio group + number input + hint. Right: date select + date pickers + language select.
reportConfigurationForm.jsx:
Features

Indicate what you want to include in your report.

{featureOptions.map(opt => (
setSelected(opt.id)} >
{opt.label}
))}

Date (optional)

Choose the start and end date

{/* DatePicker From / To — React Aria DatePicker fallback */}
reportConfigurationForm.layout: CardGrid with 4+6+6 split. Left card: stacked selectable cards. Center: radio + input. Right: selects + date pickers.
gaps: SelectableCard (card acting as radio with highlighted border) — inline styled div with conditional border/bg
DatePicker — React Aria DatePicker + Titan tokens

entityInputForm.name: Entity Input Form
entityInputForm.description: Card with title + constraint text, description, large textarea, 'Clear all' destructive link + 'Review' secondary button.
entityInputForm.jsx:
Add your entities (max: 37)

Entities include individuals, brands, or intellectual property works whose market performance can be measured.

Clear all Review Entities Information
entityInputForm.layout: Wide card (span 12). Textarea + action row below.

inlineFormCard.name: Inline Form in Card
inlineFormCard.description: Card containing a simple form: input fields, selects, and action buttons — without a dialog wrapper. For settings or inline editing scenarios.
inlineFormCard.jsx:
Settings

Cancel Save changes
inlineFormCard.layout: Full-width card. Form inside with grid layout. Action buttons flex-end at bottom.

cardHeaderWithTooltip.name: Card Header with Tooltip
cardHeaderWithTooltip.description: Title text + info icon button that triggers a tooltip. Used in nearly every data card.
cardHeaderWithTooltip.jsx: Card Title
cardHeaderWithTooltip.layout: Inline flex row. Title + icon button.

dualBarComparisonRow.name: Dual-Bar Comparison Row
dualBarComparisonRow.description: Two thin horizontal bars stacked (audience color + baseline color), each with percentage value. Used in tables and metric lists.
dualBarComparisonRow.jsx:
{audiencePct}%
{baselinePct}%
dualBarComparisonRow.layout: Grid with 2px gap. Each bar is flex row: track div + percentage span.
dualBarComparisonRow.note: Colors can be parameterized: primary bar uses --color-ocean-500 or theme accent, secondary uses --color-ocean-200 or lighter variant.

statusDotLabel.name: Status Dot + Label
statusDotLabel.description: Colored circle + text label. Used in tables for status column (Finished, Processing, etc.) and in progress summaries.
statusDotLabel.jsx: Finished
statusDotLabel.layout: Inline flex. Dot is 8x8 circle. Color map: teal=success, tomato=error, mango=warning, ocean=info.

selectableCard.name: Selectable Card (Visual Radio)
selectableCard.description: Card with border that highlights on selection. Acts as a visual radio option. Contains icon + text. Selected state: accent border + light accent background.
selectableCard.jsx:
e.key === 'Enter' && onSelect()} >
{label}
selectableCard.layout: Stacked vertically with gap. Border and background change on selection.
selectableCard.a11y: Use role=radio + aria-checked + keyboard handler for accessibility.

pillInputArea.name: Pill Tag Input Area
pillInputArea.description: Bordered area that acts like a textarea but renders terms as dismissable colored pills. User types terms separated by commas or Enter.
pillInputArea.jsx: {terms.map(t => ( ))}
pillInputArea.layout: Flex wrap container with pills + inline hidden input. Min-height to maintain visual area.
pillInputArea.note: Tone parameter varies by column: 'ocean' for include-any, 'teal' for include-all, 'mango' for exclude.

legendRow.name: Legend Row
legendRow.description: Row of colored dots + audience/series names. Used below comparison charts and bar visualizations.
legendRow.jsx: {audiences.map(a => ( {a.name} ))}
legendRow.layout: Flex wrap row. Each item is inline-flex with dot + text.

progressSummary.name: Progress Summary Card
progressSummary.description: Progress bar + rows of status counts with colored indicators. Used in sidebar status panels.
progressSummary.jsx:
0 entities added

{/* React Aria ProgressBar fallback */}
0 valid 0 exceeding 0 duplicates 0 not found
progressSummary.layout: Grid stack: progress bar + 2x2 grid of status indicators.
gaps: ProgressBar — inline div or React Aria ProgressBar

wizardHeader.name: Back + Title + CTA Header
wizardHeader.description: Left: back arrow button. Center or left-aligned: page title. Right: primary CTA. Used as header for wizard steps and form pages.
wizardHeader.jsx:
}>Back

Page Title

}>Next
wizardHeader.layout: Flex row with space-between. 3 zones: back (left), title (center), CTA (right). Optional bottom border.

showMoreLink.name: Show Full Table / Read More / Download Link
showMoreLink.description: Action link at the bottom of a truncated card to expand or navigate to full data.
showMoreLink.layout: Placed at card footer. Variants: 'Show full table →', 'Read more', 'Download ↓'.

gapsSummary.description: Components or patterns not covered by titan-compositions that the MCP should build with React Aria + Titan tokens as inline fallback.

items.name: ComparisonBar / DualComparisonBar
items.usage: Schools, Seniority, Language, Bio, Age, Device, Content type, Top Interests, Ranking
items.fallback: Inline div with background track (--color-black-200) + colored fill div. Height 6px, border-radius 3px. See dualBarComparisonRow micro-pattern.

items.name: StatusDot
items.fallback: Inline span: 8x8 circle with border-radius 50% and background from Titan color tokens. See statusDotLabel micro-pattern.

items.name: SelectableCard
items.fallback: Div with role=radio, conditional border/background using --color-ocean-500/100. See selectableCard micro-pattern.

items.name: PillInputArea
items.fallback: Bordered flex-wrap container with TitanPill components + hidden inline input. See pillInputArea micro-pattern.

items.name: DatePicker
items.fallback: React Aria DatePicker styled with Titan input tokens (--input-slot-*).

items.name: ProgressBar
items.fallback: React Aria ProgressBar or inline div with track + fill. See progressSummary micro-pattern.

items.name: LegendRow
items.usage: Below comparison charts and bar visualizations
items.fallback: Inline flex with 8x8 colored dots + text. See legendRow micro-pattern.
